timeline.bodyText: if we randomise and limit to one result, what does it matter what the ordering of the set is?
timeline.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText: The limit is only applied after the ordering and the dedicated hosts are not part of the randomization.
replies.author: Spaceman1984

replies.bodyText: ok, really not very clear code than. What would the resulting sql of this be?
replies.author: DaanHoogland

replies.bodyText:
select t.id from (
    select h.id, cd.value 
    from host h 
    join storage_pool_host_ref s on h.id = s.host_id  
    join cluster c on c.id=h.cluster_id 
    left join cluster_details cd on c.id=cd.cluster_id 
    and cd.name='cluster.storage.operations.exclude' 
    where h.status = 'Up' 
    and h.type = 'Routing' 
    and h.resource_state = 'Enabled' 
    and s.pool_id = 1
    and h.data_center_id = 1
) t 
where t.value<>'true' 
or t.value is null 
ORDER BY field(t.id, '2'), field(t.id, '5'), rand() limit 1
